alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 4:27AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Water Levels Along The Coast... A strong storm moving through the Bering Sea will bring elevated waters to coastal areas from the Yukon Delta to Point Hope. Water levels will be 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide line. This will push water up on top of the ice through cracks and along the coast. Ice may also be pushed up on shore. South of the Bering Strait, the highest water levels will be Saturday with water slowly falling through Monday, except in Eastern Norton Sound where the highest water will be Sunday night. North of the Bering Strait, the highest water levels will be Sunday night with water levels slowly falling through Monday night. Strong southeast to south winds will move into the area on Saturday morning then become southwest Sunday morning and diminish. Residents should move possessions away from the coast.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta
